TypeSignature.Value: public sealed class ApplicationTrust : System.Security.Policy.EvidenceBase, System.Security.ISecurityEncodable
.class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit ApplicationTrust extends System.Security.Policy.EvidenceBase implements class System.Security.ISecurityEncodable

Docs.summary: Encapsulates security decisions about an application. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Remarks An ApplicationTrust object is returned by a trust manager's <xref:System.Security.Policy.IApplicationTrustManager.DetermineApplicationTrust%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor creates an empty <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust> object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.ApplicationIdentity applicationIdentity) cil managed

Docs.param: An that uniquely identifies an application.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with an .

remarks.format: ## Remarks An application identity contains the full name of the application and the location of its code base.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Security.PermissionSet defaultGrantSet, class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class System.Security.Policy.StrongName> fullTrustAssemblies) cil managed

Docs.param: A default permission set that is granted to all assemblies that do not have specific grants.
An array of strong names that represent assemblies that should be considered fully trusted in an application domain.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the provided grant set and collection of full-trust assemblies.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `fullTrustAssemblies` identifies strong-named assemblies within the <xref:System.AppDomain> that are to be granted full trust. This constructor is called by the <xref:System.AppDomain.CreateDomain%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to create an <xref:System.AppDomain> that will be used as a sandbox. For more information about running an application in a sandbox, see [How to: Run Partially Trusted Code in a Sandbox](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

Docs.exception: contains an assembly that does not have a .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the application identity for the application trust object.
Docs.value: An for the application trust object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The ApplicationIdentity property uniquely identifies a manifest-based application to be activated in a new domain.

Docs.exception: cannot be set because it has a value of .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.Policy.EvidenceBase Clone() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a new object that is a complete copy of the current instance.
Docs.returns: A duplicate copy of this application trust object.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the policy statement defining the default grant set.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The DefaultGrantSet property represents the permissions that are granted to the application.
The <xref:System.Security.Policy.PolicyStatement> representing the default grants is initialized using a <xref:System.Security.PermissionSet> and optional attributes.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets extra security information about the application.
Docs.value: An object containing additional security information about the application.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void FromXml(class System.Security.SecurityElement element) cil managed

Docs.param: The XML encoding to use to reconstruct the object.
Docs.summary: Reconstructs an object with a given state from an XML encoding.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Security.ISecurityPolicyEncodable.ToXml%2A> and <xref:System.Security.ISecurityPolicyEncodable.FromXml%2A> methods are implemented to make <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust> objects XML-encodable for security policy use.

Docs.exception: The XML encoding used for is invalid.

Docs.summary: Gets the list of full-trust assemblies for this application trust.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The list identifies assemblies that are to be granted full trust within the <xref:System.AppDomain> that is associated with this <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust> instance. The assemblies are identified by their strong names.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the application has the required permission grants and is trusted to run.
Docs.value: if the application is trusted to run; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks A trust manager sets the IsApplicationTrustedToRun property to `true` when an application has been approved to execute.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether application trust information is persisted.
Docs.value: if application trust information is persisted; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks When the Persist property is `true`, application trust information is saved to the ClickOnce application store.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Security.SecurityElement ToXml() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates an XML encoding of the object and its current state.
Docs.returns: An XML encoding of the security object, including any state information.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Security.ISecurityPolicyEncodable.ToXml%2A> and <xref:System.Security.ISecurityPolicyEncodable.FromXml%2A> methods are implemented to make <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationTrust> objects XML-encodable for security policy use.
